wikipedia_page.main:
Thomas Phinn (c. 1814 – 31 October 1866) was a British barrister and Liberal Party politician.
He held various positions in the Admiralty of the United Kingdom in the mid-19th century.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1852 United Kingdom general election

response: Waite Hockin Stirling (1829 – 19 November 1923) was a 19th-century missionary with the Patagonian Missionary Society (later known as the South American Missionary Society) and was the first Anglican Bishop of the Falkland Islands. He was brother-in-law to Thomas Phinn.

In 1847, Whateley stood as a Conservative parliamentary candidate, in , but was defeated by John Twizell Wawn, the Liberal. Again, in the 1852 United Kingdom general election, he stood as the Conservative candidate for , but was unsuccessful against two Whigs, Thomas Phinn and George Treweeke Scobell.
